Position Overview

At Siemens Mobility we live and nurture an ownership culture, in which every employee takes personal responsibility for our company’s success. We utilize lean principles to continually improve our processes and customers’ experience. We trust and empower our leaders to act as owners, self-direct their teams and innovate to succeed.

As part of Siemens Mobility, the Rolling Stock Division (RS) employs approximately 1200 employees in Sacramento, CA and is part of the Siemens Mobility global Rail Systems Division.

The RS product offerings include light rail vehicles, electric and diesel-electric locomotives, passenger coaches, and high-speed trains. Core manufacturing processes include extensive car shell welding activities, bogie fabrication and assembly, electrical subassembly, finishing and paint, and final assembly. The logistics group manages all purchased and made materials supporting these manufacturing processes.

As a Logistics Industrial Engineering Intern your primary responsibility will be to drive the continuous improvement of safety, schedule, and cost savings through the use of Lean Manufacturing principles both in the warehouse and production floor. Working with the production core team members, you will lead the team in technical problem solving for topics including standard and non-standard work, tooling, material flow, safety, engineering drawings and BOMs, and process improvements.

Responsibilities:
Defining key production work steps, sequences, and durations to optimize logistics processes to support production needs
Preparing future production/warehouse floor layouts to meet planned volume and production requirements. Setting up work areas with proper processes, documentation, tooling, and equipment
Development of detailed specifications for tools and equipment for logistics and manufacturing processes using takt time, capacity calculations, engineering product design, and sourcing from vendors.
Leading logistics improvements, complex process changes, and technology changes including developing a core team, assigning / reporting to a steering committee, projecting efforts involved with implementation, and identifying impacts by generating and presenting ROI calculations.
Creating and reporting key performance indicators for current and future processes

Internship Start Date: Summer 2021

Required Qualifications:
Overall Cumulative GPA: 3.0 preferred but may consider 2.7 and above
Education: Current rising junior or senior undergraduate students pursuing a BA/BS from an accredited technical school, college or university
Majors: Industrial/System Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or relatable degree.
Work Authorization: Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States without need for current or future employer-sponsored work authorization.
Ability to work 40 hours per week

Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge and/or experience with utilizing industrial engineering methods and tools
Firm project management skills, including developing project plans, timelines / schedules, budgets, proposed layouts, resource requirements, calculating ROI, etc.
Experience manufacturing or warehouse environment in a low speed production environment (e.g. rail, aviation/aerospace, naval, heavy equipment, etc.).
Knowledge of SAP or similar MRP / ERP systems is highly desired.

The purpose of the Prepress Operations Internship role is to provide a student with exposure to and practical hands-on work experience in day-to-day prepress operations within an OEC Graphics facility. Student will have the opportunity to work as part of a team and will observe/perform typical tasks and activities in Proofing/Profiling, Prepress, and Account Management functional areas.

Location: This role is available at OEC's facilities, to include locations in Appleton & Oshkosh, Wisconsin, Spartanburg, South Carolina, and Chicago, Illinois.

Status: This role is an Internship, ideally suited for a student seeking to build real-world experience within the graphics/graphic communications industry. As such, this role is limited-term, for the summer or summer & fall semester 2021.

Hours: This role will be flexible around class schedules. Practical experiences may be on first and/or second shifts.

Learning Topics and Related Tasks May Include:

Proofing/Profiling Operations:

1. Know and understand OEC’s color management workflow and standard operating procedures.

2. Produce OEC TruJet color managed proofs using customer specific profiles/substrates on OEC Proofing devices.

3. Verify TruJet proofs for accuracy of specific profile using Certified Web.

4. Create/verify spot colors within 5 Delta E of Pantone Book/ink draw downs.

5. Trim/finalize proofs for shipment to customers.

6. Other related activities and observations as assigned.

Prepress Operations:

1. Know and understand OEC’s prepress workflow and standard operating procedures.

2. Make corrections to customer supplied art, set type, simplify vector art supplied by customer, color separations, add OEC marks and taglines, and check customer-supplied artwork against OEC files for accuracy.

3. Create job layouts and printing marks to customer specifications.

4. Accurately verify files for color separations, minimum dot, press specifications, spelling, document size, etc.

5. Other related activities and observations as assigned.

Account Coordination:

1. Know and understand OEC’s account management process and standard operating procedures.

2. Process sales orders in OEC production system by gathering all necessary information from customers and vendors via phone, email, or fax.

3. Develop, organize, and maintain all customer and in-house documentation for each job.

4. Work with Account Manager/Production Leads to manage the workflow of each job from the initial order to the final shipping of the job.

5. Other related activities and observations as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

· General flexographic, corrugated, offset knowledge is beneficial; ability to learn is essential

· Good oral and written communication, organization and problem solving skills

· Solid customer focused philosophy and ability to work directly with customers

· High level of accuracy and attention to detail; solid computer skills

· Exposure to handling demanding schedules and multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

Education and/or Experience:

Individual should be currently pursuing a degree in related field or equivalent years of experience within a prepress/printing environment. Individual must have basic knowledge of software applications, preferably with Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, PhotoShop, InDesign, Acrobat).

JOB
Interns are temporary employees who provide support for District staff at varying levels and who receive on-the-job training. Interns are assigned to work on a broad range of projects and assignments in different District units. Interns work side-by-side with District staff to obtain working knowledge and training in the area of assignment related to their field of study. Placement in this classification is temporary, and permanent employment is not guaranteed.The District may not employ more than six (6) months full-time (30 hours per week), or if working part-time or irregular time schedule no more than 1000 or 125 days in a fiscal year.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Water Production Division: Position involves working with environmental engineers to carry out assignments supporting the District's three drinking water production facilities, water distribution system, and drinking water compliance program. Interns will be supporting various projects and programs and will gain experience in water treatment processes, such as conventional filtration treatment processes and reverse osmosis technology, assist with updating drinking water regulatory plans and reports, and assist with distribution system-related programs such as the Main Cleaning Program. Typical tasks will include working with large databases, performing data analysis in excel, collecting samples in the field or laboratory and subsequent analysis with handheld or benchtop instruments, tracking lab samples, developing maps, and writing reports or procedures. Interns will work both in the office and in the field and must have a valid California driver's license.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Water Production Division: Strong analytical skills, including proficiency in spreadsheets and data management. Superior math skills, as well as strong written and oral communication skills. At least Junior class standing. Completed coursework in environmental engineering, water treatment, groundwater resources, hydrogeology, chemistry, water quality and public health.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Application materials MUST include a resume.

Full Job Description
Make your mark for patients.

We’re here because we want to build the future and transform patients’ lives for the better.

At UCB, our people are our experiences and achievements, our passion and drive. That’s why we’re looking for talented individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences - not just the best and brightest, but those who care about making a meaningful difference in the lives of patients. We promote an environment of diversity, openness, and respect where people can make valuable contributions.

An exciting journey lies ahead. Will you join us in pushing the boundaries of what’s possible?

We are seeking a motivated student scientist to join our Protein Expression and Purification group (PEP). This internship position will support the production of proteins that are used throughout UCB’s drug discovery pipeline to fuel development of new therapeutics, from antibodies to novel chemical matter. The PEP intern will learn about protein expression in different host cells and purification using chromatographic methods and will discuss optimization and characterization of protein production. Importantly, interns will receive mentorship in research, data analysis and how to achieve a career in pharmaceutical research and development. Interns will be physically on-site since this is a hands-on internship. UCB follows Massachusetts government guidelines to provide a safe working environment.

A laptop and other resources necessary to support the work will be provided.

This paid internship is currently expected to run from mid-May and continue through August 2021 with a 40-hour per week commitment.

QUALIFICATIONS AND KEY DELIVERABLES:
Candidates should be seeking a BA/BS or MS degree in cell biology, molecular biology, biochemistry, or a related discipline. Basic laboratory skills, written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail and enthusiasm for learning are required.

Beneficial skills include handling liquid cell cultures, protein purification methods, and familiarity with cloning and protein tagging. Training will be provided to ensure necessary skills are learned.

About us.

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 7,600 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

At UCB, everything we do start with a simple question: “How will this create value for people living with severe disease?”. We are on a journey to become the patient-preferred biopharma leader by delivering medicines and solutions that improve lives. We want to ensure the creation of patient value, now and into the future, while contributing to a society where a population of 8 billion people and more should be able to live a good life within limited resources of one planet.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Full Job Description
EnerSys is the global leader in stored energy solutions for industrial applications. We have over thirty manufacturing and assembly plants worldwide servicing over 10,000 customers in more than 100 countries. Worldwide headquarters are located in Reading, PA, USA with regional headquarters in Europe and Asia. We complement our extensive line of Motive Power and Energy Systems with a full range of integrated services and systems. With sales and service locations throughout the world, and over 100 years of battery experience, EnerSys is the power/full solution for stored DC power products. We continue to grow in our industry by ensuring all employees possess the following core competencies: customer focused, team player, engaged, ethical, strong communication skills, and works safely.

This position will be focusing primarily on our Reserve Power applications, which include telecommunications, IT, uninterruptible power supplies (UPS), utilities and switchgear, security, emergency lighting and general electronics. Some of the reserve power brands include PowerSafe,DataSafe, and Genesis. Our extensive product range serves a variety of reserve power applications and consistently delivers the most effective, powerful and reliable batteries available.

Job Title: Seed Corn Field Representative

Job Type: Full Time

HARTUNG BROTHERS, INC is a family owned and operated agribusiness. We have been developing a wide range of solutions for agriculture's producers and processors alike since 1975. Hartung Brothers offers agriculture contracts for seed corn and cucumbers to farmers and processors.

We are currently in need of a Seed Corn Field Representative for our Coon Rapids, Iowa Division. This position is responsible for assisting in all operations involved in seed corn production. This includes field operations in Whiting, harvest operations, seed conditioning, shipping and maintenance in Coon Rapids of company owned equipment. Training is provided to ensure proper skills development and alignment for growth within the company. The core responsibilities change with each season, allowing for a well-rounded understanding of the full process.

Responsibilities:

o Seed Conditioning (Winter)

  • Operate cleaning and sizing equipment including setting gravity table to meet company standards.
  • Maintain, calibrate and operate seed treater.
  • Operate bagging equipment and robotic palletizer.
  • Organize packaging material and program RIB blending.
  • Warehouse inventory management to keep accurate inventory.

o Harvest Operation (Fall)

  • Help coordinate green corn receiving including truck unload, hoist, husk/sort and silage chopper.
  • Assist in filling and monitor seed corn dryers.
  • Help organize shelling and bulk storage.
  • Transfer bulk product from bulk storage to conditioning building when needed.

o Field Operations - remote growing location (Spring / Summer)

  • Assist Field Manager in planting of seed fields, including isolation requirements, split planting and male delays.
  • Assist with crop scouting from pre-emergence to harvest.
  • Use GPS and mapping software to create field maps as needed.
  • Help organize detasseling operations including volunteering, rogueing, silk-shed notes, machine and hand detasseling

o Maintenance (Year round)

  • Troubleshoot and maintain company owned plant and field equipment.
  • Minimize downtime through proper Preventive Maintenance program.
  • Procure goods and services as needed.

Accurately complete all paperwork in a timely manner.
Provide coaching and training to seasonal workforce.

Cross train in both plant and field procedures and operations.

Perform duties assigned (safety, maintenance, housekeeping, etc.) to meet company standards.

Other duties as assigned.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent required. CCA, Associates or Bachelor’s degree in Ag, preferred.
  • Must be a self-motivated and detail-oriented person with ability to adapt to changing situations on a daily basis.
  • Must have strong attention to detail.
  • Familiar in the use of Microsoft office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), SAP experience is preferred.
  • Ability to work effectively as part of a team and independently.
  • Ability to obtain forklift certification.
  • Meet company’s Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) guidelines to drive a company vehicle – Class A CDL preferred.
  • Must be able to lift up to 60 pounds, occasionally up to 70 pounds.
  • Available to work days, nights, rotating shifts, weekends, overtime and overnight travel as business needs require
  • Ability to walk seed fields (occasionally up to 5 miles/day).
  • Willing to obtain a Certified pesticide applicator license if needed– Categories 1A, 1B, 1C and 4.

To apply for this opportunity: Send your resume or

apply online at WWW.HARTUNGBROTHERS.COM/CAREERS

Full Job Description
Ovenly is women-owned and -led, award-winning bakery based in New York City. We are a growing company with national ambitions and renown and are looking for dedicated, energetic, and ambitious people to join our team. There are opportunities to grow and move up within every position in the company.

At Ovenly, we make delicious and flavorful classic baked goods with a twist. Our treats are handmade but perfect and invoke a sense of nostalgia. Ovenly wants to make your day better—whether you are eating our treats or helping to make them. While baked goods are the core of what we do, we are also committed to social impact, with a focus on open hiring practices, employee wellness, and environmental sustainability. For more on our social impact efforts, visit www.oven.ly/impact.

SCOPE OF WORK

The Cake Production and Decorating Intern will learn and assist the Ovenly Cake Team in producing, baking off, assembling, and decorating our classic and seasonal/specialty cakes.

Duties include, but are not limited to:
Learns and assists with execution of cake production (scaling, mixing, assembling, decorating), special orders, and ecommerce orders
Assists with packaging cakes and special orders properly for shipping and delivery
Helps to maintain cleanliness and organization of cakes and special orders station to
Learns about food safety
Learns about the daily operations of a bakery
Reports to the Cakes and Special Orders Lead
Assist with other bakery tasks, as needed

REQUIREMENTS:
Some experience making and assembling cakes
Interest in learning about bakery production and operations
Interest in developing speed and efficiency in cake production
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Self-motivated and ability to work well on a team
English language competence

Full Job Description
POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT:
The Sr. Internal Auditor is responsible for auditing the operations and financial information of various departments within the organization to ensure accuracy and compliance with policies, procedures, GAAP, good business practices, government guidelines, and laws. The Sr. Internal Auditor will identify and report on findings, as well as make recommendations to improve policies or procedures accordingly.

DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:
Responsible for audits in North America, South America and at the Corporate entity. Occasionally may support a project in another region.
Audit key company operations for compliance and efficiency, including financial controls and SOX compliance.
Work with project management to identify and report on internal control weaknesses and recommend efficient means for improvement.
Work with project management to plan, implement and complete audits within a reasonable amount of time.
Take reasonable steps to minimize the amount of business disruption that can occur during an audit.
Projects may require 1 to 3 consecutive weeks of travel away from home. Annual travel ranges can be 10-25% of total time.
Perform additional duties as assigned.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Skills:
Ability to quickly understand company objectives, assess risks and evaluate controls.
Must have strong organizational and prioritization skills and ability to meet deadlines.
Must have excellent communication skills and interact effectively at all levels with sensitivity to cultural diversity.
Must be willing to work in various environments, including offices, labs, manufacturing plants and warehouses.
Must be able to prepare clear, organized and concise work papers and other documentation that supports testing.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.
Must be able to travel internationally, sometimes individually, carrying own luggage and adapting to local cuisine.
Must be adaptable to unexpected changes in project schedule and travel arrangements.

Experience:
3+ years of auditing experience
Strong technical skills required (e.g. – exposure to use of Computer Assisted Audit Techniques (CAATS) and audit software
Knowledge of GAAP, GAAS, IIA, COSO, Sarbanes Oxley Act, and progressive internal auditing techniques

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting and/or Finance related field
